commit_message:
Adding git to the packages to be installed

The latest build error indicaes that the git command is missing
(see http://logs.openstack.org/67/514767/3/check/openstack-ansible-functional-ubuntu-xenial/b7dca12/job-output.txt.gz#_2017-10-26_19_48_56_859442)
This adds it to the Octiavia container.

Change-Id: I6490979d208938634373c08d164461e9d5d1150a

commit_message:
[upstream] update/improve content - Project Status and Zuul

Boston was the first time we presented a section on the
Project Status and Zuul pages.  Some of the content was
not well thought out or well organized.

This patch adds some more details with additional screen shots
that follow along the process of using the status page and
better explain elastic rechecks.

Change-Id: I69f5d3dc80645260e43a1e61625b5ad265d2d6b7

subject: Fix several problems in keycloak auth module
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-26 10:13:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix several problems in keycloak auth module

1. Instead of 'realm_name' and 'password' the module
gets 'project_name' and 'api_key' respectively.
2. client_secret param is unnecessary for authentication
3. dict with 'auth_token' key should be returned, not
just a string with a token.

Change-Id: I886480b9aaec8493039ff83e114b8183a0f5fddc
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-10-25 11:10:23.000000000', 'files': ['mistralclient/auth/keycloak.py'], 'message': "Fix several problems in keycloak auth module

1. Instead of 'realm_name' and 'password' the module gets
'project_name' and 'api_key' respectively.

2. Dictionary with 'auth_token' key should be returned, not
just a string with a token.

3. Client secret is an optional parameter and shouldn't be
required during authentication.

Closes-bug: #1719560

Change-Id: I886480b9aaec8493039ff83e114b8183a0f5fddc
(cherry picked from commit e4057bb358596bc8bc1cbb8baab6c43b61d91839)
", 'number': 7}]
commit_message:
Fix several problems in keycloak auth module

1. Instead of 'realm_name' and 'password' the module gets
'project_name' and 'api_key' respectively.

2. Dictionary with 'auth_token' key should be returned, not
just a string with a token.

3. Client secret is an optional parameter and shouldn't be
required during authentication.

Closes-bug: #1719560

Change-Id: I886480b9aaec8493039ff83e114b8183a0f5fddc
(cherry picked from commit e4057bb358596bc8bc1cbb8baab6c43b61d91839)

/resource_providers/{rp_uuid}/allocations has been available since
microversion 1.0 [1], but wasn't listed in the "links" section of the

commit_message:
Include /resource_providers/uuid/allocations link

/resource_providers/{rp_uuid}/allocations has been available since
microversion 1.0 [1], but wasn't listed in the "links" section of the
GET /resource_providers response.  This change adds the link in a new
microversion, 1.11

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/366789/

Closes-Bug: #1714275

Change-Id: I6a1d320ce914926791d5f45e89bf4c601a6b10a0

commit_message:
Remove ceilometer-upgrade command

This storage drivers have been removed upstream in [1], and
resources are created in gnocchi using gnocchi-upgrade command
from gnocchi::api .

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/512700

commit_message:
Add Ref slide for howitsmade-governance

There are many links of reference sites/topic used in slide
as note (which are only viewable in presenter view).

Those links are helpful for audience to get further details
and good to mention in reference slide.

This commit adds a new reference slide with related links.

Change-Id: I51bc73cf1da86493d9d42f87b029bef9a717688b

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-23 14:43:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'libvirt: Don't disregard cache mode for instance boot disks

One of the things this commit:

    commit 14c38ac0f253036da79f9d07aedf7dfd5778fde8
    Author: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
    Date:   Thu Jul 20 19:01:23 2017 +0200

        libvirt: Post-migration, set cache value for Cinder volume(s)

    [...]

did was to supposedly remove "duplicate" calls to _set_cache_mode().

But that came back to bite us.

Now, while the Cinder volumes are taken care of w.r.t handling its cache
value during migration, but the above referred commit (14c38ac) seemed
to introduce a regression in the following ways:

  - Wrongly set the cache mode for Ceph storage backend to be 'none',
    while it should be set to 'writeback' to extract optimal
    performance.

  - It disregards the 'disk_cachemodes' Nova config parameter altogether
    for boot disks -- i.e. even though if a user set the cache mode to
    be 'writethrough', it's ignored and instead 'none' is set
    unconditionally.

Add the _set_cache_mode() calls back in _get_guest_storage_config() and
attach_volume().

Change-Id: I7370cc2942a6c8c51ab5355b50a9e5666cca042e

commit_message:
libvirt: Don't disregard cache mode for instance boot disks

One of the things this commit:

    commit 14c38ac0f253036da79f9d07aedf7dfd5778fde8
    Author: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
    Date:   Thu Jul 20 19:01:23 2017 +0200

        libvirt: Post-migration, set cache value for Cinder volume(s)

    [...]

did was to supposedly remove "duplicate" calls to _set_cache_mode().

But that came back to bite us.

Now, while the Cinder volumes are taken care of w.r.t handling its cache
value during migration, but the above referred commit (14c38ac) seemed
to introduce a regression because it disregards the 'disk_cachemodes'
Nova config parameter altogether for boot disks -- i.e. even though if
a user set the cache mode to be 'writeback', it's ignored and
instead 'none' is set unconditionally.

Add the _set_cache_mode() calls back in _get_guest_storage_config().

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1727558

Change-Id: I7370cc2942a6c8c51ab5355b50a9e5666cca042e

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-03 00:06:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'rp: move RP._set_traits() to module scope

To be consistent with the other module-level functions that handle the
raw DB access and writes for resource provider-related data, this patch
moves the ResourceProvider._set_traits() @staticmethod to the module
scope. In addition to this move, we also remove the @remotable
decoration on the ResourceProvider.set_traits() instance method (since
no resource provider objects are sent over RPC) and we ensure that the
resource provider object itself after setting traits (since the
provider generation is incremented).

Change-Id: I7667a6a4cedfe8cc4abb0785530e0859fb0c8bcf

commit_message:
rp: move RP._set_traits() to module scope

To be consistent with the other module-level functions that handle the
raw DB access and writes for resource provider-related data, this patch
moves the ResourceProvider._set_traits() @staticmethod to the module
scope. In addition to this move, we also remove the @remotable
decoration on the ResourceProvider.set_traits() instance method (since
no resource provider objects are sent over RPC) and we ensure that the
resource provider object itself resets changes after setting traits (since the
provider generation is incremented).

blueprint: de-orm-resource-providers

Change-Id: I7667a6a4cedfe8cc4abb0785530e0859fb0c8bcf

commit_message:
Remove migrated octavia zuul v3 jobs

Now that all of the octavia jobs have been migrated in-repo[1] this patch
removes the migrated jobs from the octavia project.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/512870/

Change-Id: Ic500666950104248a6f3099d1fa2c2d7835d78cf

subject: Detect when log messages are mis-formatted
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-10 22:22:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Detect when log messages are mis-formatted

This is a cross-port of part of the fixtures.py file from Nova as
ironic_fixtures.py.

There are a number of things we want to handle with logging in tests:

* Redirect the logging to somewhere that we can test or dump it later.

* Ensure that as many DEBUG messages as possible are actually
   executed, to ensure they are actually syntactically valid (they
   often have not been).

* Ensure that we create useful output for tests that doesn't
  overwhelm the testing system (which means we can't capture the
  100 MB of debug logging on every run).

To do this we create a logger fixture at the root level, which
defaults to INFO and create a Null Logger at DEBUG which lets
us execute log messages at DEBUG but not keep the output.

To support local debugging OS_DEBUG=True can be set in the
environment, which will print out the full debug logging.

There are also a set of overrides for particularly verbose
modules to be even less than INFO.

Change-Id: Ic2abdb685093785dab9625996f984dbd6520a8f9
Closes-Bug: #1503086

", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2017-10-17 23:10:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Detect when log messages are mis-formatted

This is a cross-port of part of the fixtures.py file from Nova as
ironic_fixtures.py.

There are a number of things we want to handle with logging in tests:

* Redirect the logging to somewhere that we can test or dump it later.

* Ensure that as many DEBUG messages as possible are actually
   executed, to ensure they are actually syntactically valid (they
   often have not been).

* Ensure that we create useful output for tests that doesn't
  overwhelm the testing system (which means we can't capture the
  100 MB of debug logging on every run).

To do this we create a logger fixture at the root level, which
defaults to INFO and create a Null Logger at DEBUG which lets
us execute log messages at DEBUG but not keep the output.

To support local debugging OS_DEBUG=True can be set in the
environment, which will print out the full debug logging.

There are also a set of overrides for particularly verbose
modules to be even less than INFO.

Note: This will not catch errors in log messages if 1) The call to the
logger is mocked out, or 2) The unit test never exercises the logging
call.

commit_message:
Detect when log messages are mis-formatted

This is a cross-port of part of the fixtures.py file from Nova as
ironic_fixtures.py.

There are a number of things we want to handle with logging in tests:

* Redirect the logging to somewhere that we can test or dump it later.

* Ensure that as many DEBUG messages as possible are actually
   executed, to ensure they are actually syntactically valid (they
   often have not been).

* Ensure that we create useful output for tests that doesn't
  overwhelm the testing system (which means we can't capture the
  100 MB of debug logging on every run).

To do this we create a logger fixture at the root level, which
defaults to INFO and create a Null Logger at DEBUG which lets
us execute log messages at DEBUG but not keep the output.

To support local debugging OS_DEBUG=True can be set in the
environment, which will print out the full debug logging.

There are also a set of overrides for particularly verbose
modules to be even less than INFO.

Note: This will not catch errors in log messages if 1) The call to the
logger is mocked out, or 2) The unit test never exercises the logging
call.

Change-Id: Ic2abdb685093785dab9625996f984dbd6520a8f9
Closes-Bug: #1503086

exist (grub isn't installed).

commit_message:
Use volumes for security hardened images

Instead of relying on fixed partitions, start using volumes
now that diskimage-builder is supporting it. It will give more
flexibility in terms of resizing to use the disk fully.

Change-Id: I88049da2179e2ea984e05648abb60c804a521b70

subject: cleanup unit test usage of api extension maps
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-23 21:54:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'cleanup unit test usage of api extension maps

Today our unit test code uses various ways to "patch" the global
RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP as well as extension specific maps in some cases.
This patch consolodates such patching whereby tests should use neutron's
AttributeMapMemento in their setup() chain (only once) if they updat
the global map and they should individually handle backup/restore of per
extension map updates. This change will simplify the code and make it
easier to phase-in API defintion usage with neutron-lib where we have
some as API defintions and others not. Longer term the
AttributeMapMemento will be replace with neutron-lib's fixture as we
move all extension maps to API defintions in neutron-lib.

Change-Id: I2586f0b11b107d7f57214a0d65bcf7c38a5f0ebb

commit_message:
cleanup unit test usage of api extension maps

Today our unit test code uses various ways to "patch" the global
RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP as well as extension specific maps in some cases.
This patch consolidates such patching whereby tests should use neutron's
AttributeMapMemento in their setup() chain (only once) if they update
the global map and they should individually handle backup/restore of per
extension map updates. This change will simplify the code and make it
easier to phase-in API definition usage with neutron-lib where we have
some as API definitions and others not. Longer term the
AttributeMapMemento will be replace with neutron-lib's fixture as we
move all extension maps to API definitions in neutron-lib.

Change-Id: I2586f0b11b107d7f57214a0d65bcf7c38a5f0ebb

commit_message:
Ansible-lint project-config

Since project-config is trusted and thus not self-testing, add a new
job for ansible linting in openstack-zuul-jobs and use this here.

Once this job is stable, we can use the job openstack-zuul-jobs-linters
job and merge the tox environments.

Depends-On: I9fbfe70646f548b3ff1f3022933cab65481b347b
Change-Id: I1243aa8344a4573e3c43c3ced45cf740a631efa9

commit_message:
Zuul: add checks for fedora

This PS adds fedora to the list of distros that OSH-Infra is checked
against.

It also makes the CentOS gate non-voting untill stability issues are
resolved.

Change-Id: I321ee592eeca75f66090747a74a02c7c0ba80bc5

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-03 00:06:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "rp: Remove RP.get_traits() method

When listing data, we use the
[Object]List.get_all_by_resource_provider_uuid() pattern. Except for
resource provider traits. For resource provider traits, we had a
ResourceProvider.get_traits() instance method.

This patch makes the getting of resource provider traits follow a
consistent pattern and makes a TraitList.get_all_by_provider_id()
@classmethod that matches similar items like
UsageList.get_all_by_resource_provider_uuid() and
AllocationList.get_all_by_resource_provider_uuid(). Note that instead of
get_all_by_resource_provider_uuid(), I went with
get_all_by_resource_provider_id(). This is intentional. Asking for
traits (or usages or allocations for that matter) by resource provider
UUID when we already know the resource provider's internal ID (because
we always look up the resource provider object first by UUID) is
wasteful and causes us to do an unnecessary JOIN to the
resource_providers table. I'll be updating the existing
get_all_by_resource_provider_uuid() methods on UsageList,
InventoryList, and AllocationList to be by internal ID instead of UUID
in upcoming patches.

Change-Id: If756b06a10aba8481de7e6cbcd940900557e78bc

commit_message:
rp: Remove RP.get_traits() method

When listing data, we use the
[Object]List.get_all_by_resource_provider_uuid() pattern. Except for
resource provider traits. For resource provider traits, we had a
ResourceProvider.get_traits() instance method.

This patch makes the getting of resource provider traits follow a
consistent pattern and makes a TraitList.get_all_by_provider()
@classmethod that accepts a ResourceProvider object and returns a
TraitList containing traits associated with the resource provider.

In following patches, I change similar method on List objects like
UsageList.get_all_by_resource_provider_uuid() and
AllocationList.get_all_by_resource_provider_uuid() to match this new
pattern of get_all_by_resource_provider() and passing in a
ResourceProvider object.

Note that instead of get_all_by_resource_provider_uuid(), I went with
get_all_by_resource_provider(). This is intentional. Asking for traits
(or usages or allocations for that matter) by resource provider UUID
when we already know the resource provider's internal ID (because we
always look up the resource provider object first by UUID) is wasteful
and causes us to do an unnecessary JOIN to the resource_providers
table.

blueprint: de-orm-resource-providers

Change-Id: If756b06a10aba8481de7e6cbcd940900557e78bc

commit_message:
Add DNS HA as an ha resource option

Add dnsha as a HA option for this charm. This will trigger
charms.openstack to check for DNS HA settings and configure
them accordingly.

Change-Id: I471b5798ae3779d56a085d4bcfd90d84e39d4395
Partial-bug: #1727376
Depends-On: I1a6cdeffa3aa8657b957ba68cd09face27f93b27

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-26 19:58:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'make sahara-dashboard a separate deliverable

The additional release job validation in the releases repo depends on
all of the components of a deliverable being similar enough that they
use the same release jobs. The sahara-dashboard component uses a
special job variant that the other components do not use, so it needs
to be split out as a separate item. This patch does that, and copies
all of the relevant tags to the new deliverable for consistency.

Change-Id: I461ca8acf34b545cc704a5a36ace061079959227
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

The sahara-dashboard component uses a special job variant that the

commit_message:
split up sahara deliverables

The additional release job validation in the releases repo depends on
all of the components of a deliverable being similar enough that they
use the same release jobs.

The sahara-dashboard component uses a special job variant that the
other components do not use. The sahara-extra and
sahara-image-elements components are not services either.

This patch divides up the deliverables and copies all of the relevant
tags to the new items for consistency.

Change-Id: I461ca8acf34b545cc704a5a36ace061079959227
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Make migration uuid hold allocations for migrating instances

This makes us swap the instance's allocation for one held by the migration
during a cold move operation. If we need to revert back, we swap again,
and if not, we just delete the migration's allocation against the source
node when confirming.

Related to blueprint migration-allocations

Change-Id: I89e2682c9210901cf1992dac2f9068b51f0373cd

commit_message:
Add ansible-linter job for project-config

Add a temporary job for project-config testing that mirrors
openstack-zuul-jobs-linters but uses ansible-lint tox environment.

This allows iteration on the lint tests for project-config.

Change-Id: I9fbfe70646f548b3ff1f3022933cab65481b347b
Needed-By: I1243aa8344a4573e3c43c3ced45cf740a631efa9

subject: Remove unified queue from gate pipeline
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-23 10:25:39.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/project.yaml'], 'message': "Remove unified queue from gate pipeline

Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).

As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.

Change-Id: I622f33f14782c0fe45d6db33a629014e1e6fb284
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove unified queue from gate pipeline

Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).

As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.

Change-Id: I622f33f14782c0fe45d6db33a629014e1e6fb284

commit_message:
Convert IVS VIF plugging / unplugging to privsep.

This follows the same pattern as previous conversions. I've deliberately
gone for small methods with defined tasks here instead of one big "plug
the thing" method in the hope that this way the code will be more
reusable.

Change-Id: I3840c2e0b0e0e8e2dffbe2f423208c7da6f19c04
blueprint: hurrah-for-privsep

commit_message:
Remove barbican from scope of ksa adapter work

Since barbican conf options are both exposed by and consumed within the
castellan library, it doesn't make sense to try to hack Nova to
translate the common ksa options in such a way that castellan can
consume them without changes.  This patch updates the spec accordingly.

Change-Id: I5e8a8c2569111475f27d92182f98b0ffcae3cd8b
Implements: bp use-ksa-adapter-for-endpoints

subject: rabbit: make ack/requeue thread-safe
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-02 08:37:37.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqpdriver.py'], 'message': "rabbit: make ack/requeue thread-safe

ack/requeue messages are currently done in the
MessageHandlingServer._process_incoming().

But _process_incoming() in run by a futurist Executor.
That can be a threading or an eventlet executor.

With eventlet, we don't really share the socket between threads.

But with threading executor and expecialy ssl, this can't work, if you
write data with two different threads to the socket.

This change moves back the message ack/requeue to the polling threads
that handle the connection, instead of the threads we spawn for the
application.

Oslo Messaging now always use a connection in the same thread.

Change-Id: I5c0e6def6b34f4d195fb1f8dbb26eda0f21ff34e
(cherry picked from commit 7e71ac821f4103032afc8eff8007ad48afe49a2c)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
rabbit: make ack/requeue thread-safe

ack/requeue messages are currently done in the
MessageHandlingServer._process_incoming().

But _process_incoming() in run by a futurist Executor.
That can be a threading or an eventlet executor.

With eventlet, we don't really share the socket between threads.

But with threading executor and expecialy ssl, this can't work, if you
write data with two different threads to the socket.

This change moves back the message ack/requeue to the polling threads
that handle the connection, instead of the threads we spawn for the
application.

Oslo Messaging now always use a connection in the same thread.

Change-Id: I5c0e6def6b34f4d195fb1f8dbb26eda0f21ff34e
(cherry picked from commit 7e71ac821f4103032afc8eff8007ad48afe49a2c)

subject: Add need for -stable-maint and -release groups
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-27 13:12:40.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/stable-branches.rst', 'doc/source/release-management.rst'], 'message': "Add need for -stable-maint and -release groups

Release management assumes that all projects following a
cycle-with-milestones model will use a $PROJECT-release
team to review backports between RC1 and final.

It also assumes that all projects following the stable
policy will use a $PROJECT-stable-maint team.

So let's document that common practice!

NB: All teams already follow this pattern, except Kolla.
Once this merges (and depending on the conclusion of the
discussion around a deploytools-centric stable policy
variant), I'll fix the Kolla exception accordingly.

Change-Id: I3870e8463c6374df17c74579e7332d659ae634ac
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add need for -stable-maint and -release groups

Release management assumes that all projects following a
cycle-with-milestones model will use a $PROJECT-release
team to review backports between RC1 and final.

It also assumes that all projects following the stable
policy will use a $PROJECT-stable-maint team.

So let's document that common practice!

NB: All teams already follow this pattern, except Kolla.
Once this merges (and depending on the conclusion of the
discussion around a deploytools-centric stable policy
variant), I'll fix the Kolla exception accordingly.

Change-Id: I3870e8463c6374df17c74579e7332d659ae634ac

commit_message:
Change OVS agent to update skipped port status to DOWN

When the OVS agent skips processing a port because it was
not found on the integration bridge, it doesn't send back
any status to the server to notify it.  This can cause the
port to get stuck in the BUILD state indefinitely, since
that is the default state it gets before the server tells
the agent to update it.

The OVS agent will now notify the server that any skipped
device should be considered DOWN if it did not exist.

Change-Id: I15dc55951cdb75c6d87d7c645f8e2cbf82b2f3e4
Closes-bug: #1719011

commit_message:
Fix launcher tests

* The were race conditions in launcher tests. They sometimes failed
  because they expected a certain number of services running. But
  they not always had enough time to complete the launch process.
  This patch fixes it by using the _await() utility method as in
  other tests.

Change-Id: I6d13b1ba7b7d245ee7fe602120095aaa6fce90b9

Nova will always use an unqualified host name for an instance's
compute node. If monasca-agent is configured to use a compute
node's fully qualified host name for metrics and that gets used for
looking up the instances running on that node, Nova will return

commit_message:
libvirt check: use unqualified hostname

Nova will always use an unqualified host name for an instance's
compute node. If monasca-agent is configured to use a compute
node's fully qualified host name for metrics and that gets used for
looking up the instances running on that node, Nova will return
zero results. This commit fixes this problem by always reducing
the the host name to its first component.

Change-Id: Ie29cb2dc305c8b2d4c551d1512e0e755f9e38cb6
Story: 2001251
Task: 5781

[{'created': '2017-01-05 17:19:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Decrease times of communication in manage volume

Currently, manage-existing flow requires
at least twice getting volume information from a storage.
(1. volume size for quota by manage_existing_get_size,
 2. detailed volume info for managing on Cinder by manage_existing)

It can be inefficient for some storages which take almost same time to
get size / get size & detailed volume info.
This patch adds the way to get information for manage_existing at once
by adding manage_existing_get_info which functions as below.

  a. (Default)
     Gets only volume size, and returns size, None
     After that, execute above 2. procedure in ManageExistingTask
     in conventional way.

  b. Gets volume size and detailed volume info together,
     and returns size, model_update.
     Then, skip above 2. procedure in ManageExistingTask.
     (Driver developer can select this way by implementing
      manage_existing_get_info)

Change-Id: I3a6444ea9ff2c4c0ed38487e12f4f275973fe88d
Implements: blueprint improve-mange-volume
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-01-05 17:34:20.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/flows/test_manage_volume_flow.py', 'cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/volume/flows/manager/manage_existing.py'], 'message': 'Decrease times of communication in manage volume

  a. (Default)
     Gets only volume size, and returns size, None
     After that, execute above 2. procedure in ManageExistingTask
     in conventional way.

  b. Gets volume size and detailed volume info together,
     and returns size, model_update.
     Then, skip above 2. procedure in ManageExistingTask.
     (Driver developer can select this way by implementing
      manage_existing_get_info)

Change-Id: I3a6444ea9ff2c4c0ed38487e12f4f275973fe88d
Implements: blueprint improve-mange-volume
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Decrease times of communication in manage volume

Currently, manage-existing flow requires
at least twice getting volume information from a storage.
(1. volume size for quota by manage_existing_get_size,
 2. detailed volume info for managing on Cinder by manage_existing)

It can be inefficient for some storages which take almost same time to
get size / get size & detailed volume info.
This patch adds the way to get information for manage_existing at once
by adding manage_existing_get_info which functions as below.

  a. (Default)
     Gets only volume size, and returns size, None
     After that, execute above 2. procedure in ManageExistingTask
     in conventional way.

  b. Gets volume size and detailed volume info together,
     and returns size, model_update.
     Then, skip above 2. procedure in ManageExistingTask.
     (Driver developer can select this way by implementing
      manage_existing_get_info)

Change-Id: I3a6444ea9ff2c4c0ed38487e12f4f275973fe88d
Implements: blueprint improve-mange-volume

commit_message:
Fix post upload images task

After migration to zuulv3/ansible upgrade post upload task start
uploading files into UPLOAD_TAR and UPLOAD_RAW directories.

This patch fixes post task to keep correct directory structure
on destination host.

commit_message:
Fuel branch cleanup

With the retirement of newton and several older numeric branches, update
branch conditions and remove now unused jobs.

After reviewing the older v2 config, I noticed a couple of conversion
errors, so fixed them.

Now the branch conditions only match existing branches.

Note that fuel's stable/8.0 branch is running on trusty.

Change-Id: I473f248af283cd7fe16cd7a306e61a78978ccc3a

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

This also updates the docs and release notes to latest
standards, instead of having a different code.

Change-Id: Ifb12f8cf8089b7c672ef1e5e99788ab255633c14

commit_message:
Reusing context defined in base class

Unit test for dhcp server creates context, whenever it needs.
But context is already created in base class therefor we don't
need to get new context, already existing context can be reused.

Change-Id: I8427091dbff0bf8334f9af4057812ad30c69ec02

subject: Remove unified queue from gate pipeline
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-24 15:45:21.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/project.yaml'], 'message': "Remove unified queue from gate pipeline

Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).

As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.

Change-Id: I88d5d35995f63107135d8e4d8539eac7f85f1db9
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove unified queue from gate pipeline

Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).

As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.

Change-Id: I88d5d35995f63107135d8e4d8539eac7f85f1db9

commit_message:
Check if a host is reserved before deleting it

Currently, if you try to delete a host which is reserved, it is removed
from the freepool but remains in the computehosts table. This patch
checks if the host is reserved before removing it.

Change-Id: I3daaba338809375e16018ae5e03107d938e89b9c
Closes-Bug: #1721456

commit_message:
use ml2 driver api from neutron-lib

The ml2 plugin driver API was rehomed into neutron-lib with commit
Ifc829953ef4d5859c3475903965dc08aba42fd9c and the API was shimmed in
neutron with I86a10091b55d1123e8d16f16155e0312bb10e54c. In prep for
neutron consumption Ice49572e217eeaf820e48d40f2251d08766490b5 this
patch switches over to lib's version of the respective code.

Change-Id: Ia43ed7cce3a5750dce1e84af535c050a3bef0155

commit_message:
Replace jsonutils by ujson

ujson is faster than jsonutils, and we do not need any fancy feature jsonutils
might offer.

This also has the benefit of removing a big dependency on Ceilometer.

commit_message:
Update CephPools format in the docker templates to fit ceph-ansible

The format which ceph-ansible uses to describe the list of pools
to be created in the cluster is different from the one which
puppet-ceph uses; this commit updates the description and the
the docker templates accordingly.

Change-Id: I1e5b2c3cbf6ae02c19a2275ca119fed6e173319d
Closes-Bug: #1720373

commit_message:
Parameterising iscsi_helper and setting default value

Tgt while still used in some distributions is being
replaced in others by targetcli. In order to allow
this value to be configurable, I've added it to
cinder's main.yml and added a default value of tgtadm.
This applies when cinder is using an LVM/iscsi backend.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I971e37e2d8c7f589d12244f9381734359c4a686d

commit_message:
Remove warning during kolla_docker execution

Ansible check if modules parameters are named like
%password% and allow to hidden log param in this case.
This requires adding "no_log" parameters.
This patch just add "no_log" param in order to avoid
this warning.

Change-Id: I9c1df1093e0fd101090292d6e8bf3527f99aeb17
Closes-Bug: #1702244

commit_message:
Fix unconfirm for swift backend

Users can't unconfirm the subscription when use swift backend.

This patch fixed this error.

Change-Id: Ie3da9b767f02f96ccd99ed8c148a2940e519b3cd
(cherry picked from commit 613da305b2893913b7190b8c6b152e426cc9a285)

commit_message:
Add more backoff functions

This patch introduces more retry backoff function the delivery 
retry policy into Zaqar. It will work when Zaqar failed to send 
the notification to the subscriber. Users can define the retry 
backoff function in the options of subscription or metadata 
of queue.

Change-Id: I0bffd9249f8a0d466ecea1ac36d8adc37b742238
Implement: blueprint support-more-backoff-functions

commit_message:
Remove migrated legacy puppet openstack check jobs

This patch removes the legacy-puppet-check-jobs that have been
migrated into the puppet-openstack-integration repository[1].
puppet modules switch to use new puppet-openstack-check jobs in
project-config repository[2]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508296/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508736/

Change-Id: Ib7054ddad8ed8e70dbe1ed7fd297acef162bb535

commit_message:
Upload to pypi if pre / run was successful

If we failed to build a wheel / tarball, we don't actually want to
attempt an upload. Checking the zuul_status results will provide that
information.

Change-Id: If0afb88f5063fe11e664a0393528933911da667b
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add a config option to disable cron triggers

* Cron triggers (implemented in periodic.py) are always enabled
  although in many installations they are not needed. When they
  are enabled they consume resoruces (keep polling DB etc.).
  This patch add the config option "enabled" under "cron_trigger"
  group that can be used to disable the entire subsystem.
* Wiped out "disable_cron_trigger_thread" pecan app config variable
  that was use to disable cron triggers in unit tests in favor of
  the new config option
* Other minor style changes

Closes-bug: #1724147
Change-Id: I79b9ccb2f4286b3ea8696b7cd65472c8a49937bf

commit_message:
Stop masking VIP allocate neutron errors

Previously the neutron network driver was masking the actual error being
returned from neutron while doing a VIP port allocation.
This patch will pass through the neutron error to the user if it is
an API ready exception giving the user more useful information about the
error neutron is reporting. For example that the requested VIP address is
already allocated.

Change-Id: Ic327b06ff9ccf9ae0c9931a8e6569c20d03c4a79
Closes-Bug: #1714593
Story: 1714593
Task: 5005

commit_message:
update contributor internals index

A number of our RSTs under doc/srouce/contributor/internals/* are not
referenced from the index.rst and as a result are not
published/accessible in our docs.

This patch updates the index to ref all internal pages.

Change-Id: If534f8d6a7da2807285edb6885c800696d1c50a9
Closes-Bug: #1712907

commit_message:
Add SAN policy setter/getter

This change adds a setter and getter for the SAN policy, controlling
the way in which new disks will be handled (brought online or not).

Validating this policy will help prevent common vm disk attachment
issues when dealing with passthrough disks.

Related-Bug: #1727257

Change-Id: I25033c15b77f494a417c9cd01d194a8bfb3cfe13

subject: Add method returning vswitch extensions
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-19 11:46:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add method returning vswitch extensions

This change adds a new method returning available extensions for
a given vswitch. It returns a list of dicts that include vswitch
extension information.

This method is required by the Neutron Hyper-V agent in order to
validate a configured vSwitch.

Note that this change also adds the CIM enabled state constants
(which are re-used for various type of resources).

Related-Bug: #1592777

Change-Id: I0856a23030480d435fd0582fc6b4bc688c98ae93
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-10-25 09:23:45.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/constants.py', 'os_win/tests/unit/utils/network/test_networkutils.py', 'os_win/utils/network/networkutils.py'], 'message': 'Add method returning vswitch extensions

This change adds a new method returning available extensions for
a given vswitch. It returns a list of dicts that include vswitch
extension information.

This method is required by the Neutron Hyper-V agent in order to
validate a configured vSwitch.

Note that this change also adds the CIM enabled state constants
(which are re-used for various type of resources).

Related-Bug: #1592777

Change-Id: I0856a23030480d435fd0582fc6b4bc688c98ae93
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Add method returning vswitch extensions

This change adds a new method returning available extensions for
a given vswitch. It returns a list of dicts that include vswitch
extension information.

This method is required by the Neutron Hyper-V agent in order to
validate a configured vSwitch.

Note that this change also adds the CIM enabled state constants
(which are re-used for various type of resources).

Related-Bug: #1592777

Change-Id: I0856a23030480d435fd0582fc6b4bc688c98ae93

subject: Silently continue when destroying missing vNIC
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-19 09:26:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Silently continue when destroying missing vNIC

At the moment, if requested to destroy an inexistent VM NIC,
os-win will raise an IndexError, which is not really helpful.

In quite a few other cases, we're silently continuing when dealing
with missing resources. We'll do the same here as well.

Change-Id: Ibe290ba2521a808f3dba150de33f9be0b3519e7c
Related-Bug: #1724282
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-10-25 09:35:30.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/tests/unit/utils/compute/test_vmutils.py', 'os_win/utils/compute/vmutils.py'], 'message': "Silently continue when destroying missing vNIC

At the moment, if requested to destroy an inexistent VM NIC,
os-win will raise an IndexError, which is not really helpful.

In quite a few other cases, we're silently continuing when dealing
with missing resources. We'll do the same here as well.

Change-Id: Ibe290ba2521a808f3dba150de33f9be0b3519e7c
Related-Bug: #1724282
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Silently continue when destroying missing vNIC

At the moment, if requested to destroy an inexistent VM NIC,
os-win will raise an IndexError, which is not really helpful.

In quite a few other cases, we're silently continuing when dealing
with missing resources. We'll do the same here as well.

Change-Id: Ibe290ba2521a808f3dba150de33f9be0b3519e7c
Related-Bug: #1724282

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-24 15:06:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "L3 Support for ODL deployments

The current ODL deployment does not correctly support L3 when ODL implements
the L3 logic (instead of using neutron-L3-agent).This patch adds support for
that.

Note that the neutron_plugin_base variable is a list with the neutron plugins
to be used and it is read by neutron.conf to list them. If this variable has
odl-router or odl-router_v2, neutron will delegate the routing logic to ODL
and will not start neutron-L3-agent.

There are some steps missing to make ODL-L3 work, like setting a gateway.
Those steps are not included because they depend on the public network IP
range, which will be set by the user when creating the network. However,
I believe it is necessary to cover those steps in a guide but I don't know
exactly where. Can somebody please point me to what file to use for this?

Change-Id: I819e566c192ab1a00736f0aa9d7d04939f84f66d

Note that the neutron_plugin_base variable is a list with the neutron plugins
to be used and it is read by neutron.conf to list them. If this variable has
odl-router or odl-router_v2, neutron will delegate the routing logic to ODL
and will not start neutron-L3-agent.

commit_message:
L3 Support for ODL deployments

The current ODL deployment does not correctly support L3 when ODL implements
the L3 logic (instead of using neutron-L3-agent)

Note that the neutron_plugin_base variable is a list with the neutron plugins
to be used and it is read by neutron.conf to list them. If this variable has
odl-router or odl-router_v2, neutron will delegate the routing logic to ODL
and will not start neutron-L3-agent.

Change-Id: I819e566c192ab1a00736f0aa9d7d04939f84f66d

subject: Remove unified queue from gate pipeline
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-23 10:26:55.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/project.yaml'], 'message': "Remove unified queue from gate pipeline

Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).

As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.

Change-Id: I717e111e8cc85f8396bddf317a2a27969a5728e7
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove unified queue from gate pipeline

Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).

As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.

Change-Id: I717e111e8cc85f8396bddf317a2a27969a5728e7

commit_message:
Properly sort Heat stacks on Created field

replace the 'timesince_or_never' filter with 'timesince_sorted' one as the
creation_time attribute of a Heat stack can not actually be None.
Also add a 'timesince' data-type to this field.

Change-Id: I9727254b4c255331562083f957133ed6e3cd7e90
Closes-Bug: #1713748

commit_message:
Change ENABLE_KSM to $ENABLE_KSM

* Since ENABLE_KSM param will be used in local.conf file
  and it's value is received in a variable and while compairing,
  the variable needs to be compared. So we need to change the
  same.

Change-Id: Id4ed17c0642acd2313e456503cfc375ca6f61409
Closes-Bug: #1724690

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-01 20:02:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Additional v3 identity client endpoints

This patch adds additional v3 identity client endpoints,
including APIs for:
  - get_auth_domains
  - get_auth_catalog

Note that running the tests ``test_show_auth_catalog`` and
``test_list_auth_domains`` depends on the value of the flag
``CONF.identity.admin_domain_scope``: in the former case,
a 403 Forbidden [0] is thrown if a domain-scoped token
is passed and, in the latter case, domain-scoped tokens
are required to list all domains a user has access to
via domain role assignments.

Also note that none of these tests require admin credentials [1]
yet have been created in the admin sub-folder for identity
because ``test_list_auth_projects`` was already present therein.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/auth/controllers.py#L408
[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/common/policies/auth.py

commit_message:
List auth domains v3 identity endpoint

This commit adds ``list_auth_domains`` to the v3 identity
client.

Note that the related test doesn't require admin credentials [0]
yet has been created in the admin sub-folder for identity
because ``test_list_auth_projects`` was already present therein.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/82f60fe22c405829f8e5f6576f25cf3663b10f73/keystone/auth/controllers.py#L410

Change-Id: Ie50c30bfff1900a9056aaedca7ba15b0d9573eab

subject: Respect co-builder partition moves when min_part_hours is zero
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4608, 'name': 'Kota Tsuyuzaki', 'email': 'kota.tsuyuzaki.pc@hco.ntt.co.jp', 'username': 'tsuyuzaki-kota'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-31 15:10:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Respect co-builder partition moves when min_part_hours is zero

Repeated calls to each co-builder's _update_last_part_moves() are
unnecessary and have the unfortunate side effect of resetting the
_last_part_moved bitmap. When a component builder has zero
min_part_hours this results in it not preventing its co-builders from
moving parts that it has already moved.

This patch changes the CompositeRingBuilder to call each component
builder _update_last_part_moves() *once* before rebalancing any
component builder. CooperativeRingBuilder's no longer forward calls to
their _update_last_part_moves() method. Each component's
_last_part_moved bitmap is therefore preserved until for the duration
of the composite rebalance.

The initialisation of the RingBuilder _last_part_moves array is moved
to the RingBuilder __init__ method, so that calls to
_update_last_part_moves() are effective even when rebalance() has
never been called on that builder. Otherwise, during a composite
rebalance, a component that has not previously been rebalanced will
not have its _last_part_moves_epoch updated during rebalance and as a
result may report erroneous min_part_seconds_left after its first
rebalance.

Related-Change: I1b30cb3d776be441346a4131007d2487a5440a81
Closes-Bug: #1714274
Change-Id: Ib165cf974c865d47c2d9e8f7b3641971d2e9f404
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-09-07 17:51:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Respect co-builder partition moves when min_part_hours is zero

Repeated calls to each co-builder's _update_last_part_moves() are
unnecessary and have the unfortunate side effect of resetting the
_last_part_moved bitmap. When a component builder has zero
min_part_hours this results in it not preventing its co-builders from
moving parts that it has already moved.

This patch changes the CompositeRingBuilder to call each component
builder _update_last_part_moves() *once* before rebalancing any
component builder. CooperativeRingBuilder's no longer forward calls to
their _update_last_part_moves() method. Each component's
_last_part_moved bitmap is therefore preserved until for the duration
of the composite rebalance.

The initialisation of the RingBuilder _last_part_moves array is moved
to the RingBuilder __init__ method, so that calls to
_update_last_part_moves() are effective even when rebalance() has
never been called on that builder. Otherwise, during a composite
rebalance, a component that has not previously been rebalanced will
not have its _last_part_moves_epoch updated during rebalance and as a
result may report erroneous min_part_seconds_left after its first
rebalance.

Related-Change: I1b30cb3d776be441346a4131007d2487a5440a81
Closes-Bug: #1714274
Change-Id: Ib165cf974c865d47c2d9e8f7b3641971d2e9f404

of the composite rebalance.

The initialisation of the RingBuilder _last_part_moves array is moved

commit_message:
Respect co-builder partition moves when min_part_hours is zero

Repeated calls to each co-builder's _update_last_part_moves() are
unnecessary and have the unfortunate side effect of resetting the
_last_part_moved bitmap. When a component builder has zero
min_part_hours this results in it not preventing its co-builders from
moving parts that it has already moved.

This patch changes the CompositeRingBuilder to call each component
builder _update_last_part_moves() *once* before rebalancing any
component builder. CooperativeRingBuilder's no longer forward calls to
their _update_last_part_moves() method. Each component's
_last_part_moved bitmap is therefore preserved until for the duration
of the composite rebalance.

The initialisation of the RingBuilder _last_part_moves array is moved
to the RingBuilder __init__ method, so that calls to
_update_last_part_moves() are effective even when rebalance() has
never been called on that builder. Otherwise, during a composite
rebalance, a component that has not previously been rebalanced will
not have its _last_part_moves_epoch updated during rebalance and as a
result may report erroneous min_part_seconds_left after its first
rebalance.

Related-Change: I1b30cb3d776be441346a4131007d2487a5440a81
Closes-Bug: #1714274
Change-Id: Ib165cf974c865d47c2d9e8f7b3641971d2e9f404

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-k8s-cookiecutter under tripleo

TripleO is going to host the ansible-role-k8s-* repos under its umbrela
during the kickstart phase. Hopefully, these projects will grow outside
the tripleo umbrella and become their own team eventually.

The ansible-role-k8s-* repos will contain ansible roles to deploy
openstack services on kubernetes. The cookiecutter template is the first
repo that is being imported under the openstack/tripleo group.

Depends-On: Ie47461c5dab7062ea65a93a49b5c0d651f19a607
Change-Id: Ie3d6d2a108af7e796133a5158678773b34a12ad2

commit_message:
Remove _create_router in scenario.manager

_create_router is used only once in scenario.manager, so this is to:
1. remove _create_router
2. move the logic of creating router to _get_router
3. pass external_gateway_info argument to client.create_router
   instead of using client.update_router
4. use self.__class__.__name__ as prefix of random router name
5. remove self.assertEqual(router['name'], name), and add this
   check in api test test_create_show_list_update_delete_router.

Change-Id: I5aa5a42aaa1ebd654b7e979e3807d3edbf2efa9e

commit_message:
Remove routers_client from manager._create_subnet

This is to:
1. remove routers_client from manager._create_subnet
   because routers_client is not used for creating subnet.
2. rename _create_subnet to create_subnet for it is used
   by several testcases.

Change-Id: I102c3b01abe0ae752196d27893d43e64acfb57a6

commit_message:
Fix keystonemiddleware.auth_token failure

The senlin script for devstack will setup to use
keystone v2 as default url in keystonemiddleware,
since keystone remove its v2 api, so it will failed
on authentication.

fix-bug: #1727904
Change-Id: I61cf8902eef86efb9cfc82f0061f8b82bfc221f8

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 15.1.11

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

On top of it, ceph-ansible 2.2.11 was pointing to some PPAs that
do not exist anymore. They were changed to include the version
number for nfs-ganesha. This bumps the version to a new tag that
includes the updated PPAs

Co-Authored-By: Sam Yaple <sam@yaple.net>

Depends-On: Id5245ca94ceacb488bf55c4dba0fbc296f0dd304
Change-Id: Ibbba66213782eadae9064fa5d790a181ddbf8d46

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 14.2.11

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: Ie2a1f5b9ce7504173ca8a142741a06fdef4e5e00
Change-Id: I3031655b5fce298f3a9765ebbb38c4b2fc0e280c

from the Zuul reference or master made the new ZuulV3 based
tox gates failing.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-27 07:25:08.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/recheck-quota-conf-043a5d6057b33282.yaml'], 'message': 'Mention API behavior change when over quota limit

In
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/cells-count-resources-to-check-quota-in-api
we introduced a new workflow of Quota checks. It is possible that
concurrent requests can pass API layer checks, but blocked by
conductor layer checks.

This can actually trigger user-noticeable API behavior changes:
As an user, previously, If my request is blocked by quota checks, I will
get HTTP 403 response, and no instance records will be left.

After the above mentioned change, it is possible that when my requests
failed at conductor layer Quota check and I got an instance in ERROR
state. And in an busy cloud, users may got a lot of ERROR instances
according to this and the instance number may beyond the limit.

We should at least mention this behavior change in the release note.

Change-Id: Ib531adc0ae4ddaf92616d3779bd81f519c2f4dec
Closes-Bug: #1718567
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Mention API behavior change when over quota limit

In
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/cells-count-resources-to-check-quota-in-api
we introduced a new workflow of Quota checks. It is possible that
concurrent requests can pass API layer checks, but blocked by
conductor layer checks.

This can actually trigger user-noticeable API behavior changes:
As an user, previously, If my request is blocked by quota checks, I will
get HTTP 403 response, and no instance records will be left.

After the above mentioned change, it is possible that when my requests
failed at conductor layer Quota check and I got an instance in ERROR
state. And in an busy cloud, users may got a lot of ERROR instances
according to this and the instance number may beyond the limit.

We should at least mention this behavior change in the release note.

Change-Id: Ib531adc0ae4ddaf92616d3779bd81f519c2f4dec
Closes-Bug: #1718567

subject: Constraint Pandas and Numpy for gnocchi
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-26 11:52:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'pandas and numpy stable versions are provided to be installed.

On Openstack-ansible all the pip packages are mirrored and fetched
on the repo_server.So I realized that pandas version 0.21.0rc1 is installed
but this version is not stable.it is not compatible with numpy 1.12.0 version.
I asked gnocchi channel and they suggested using pandas stable version.
So I provide pandas 0.20.3 and nump 1.12.0 versions to be installed.

Change-Id: If0e2cbebdbdebe7c71851d532b5f8629334b1aaf
Closes-Bug: #1724538
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-10-26 13:05:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Constraint Pandas and Numpy for gnocchi.

The repo build is building pandas version 0.21.0rc1, incompatible with gnocchi
and numpy.This comes because gnocchi isn't upper constrained, and the version
to be installed is the latest one available (due to a >= requirement).
We should instead constraint both pip packages to make possible to install
gnocchi.

Change-Id: If0e2cbebdbdebe7c71851d532b5f8629334b1aaf
Closes-Bug: #1724538
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2017-10-26 13:07:07.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Constraint Pandas and Numpy for gnocchi

isn't upper constrained, and the version to be installed is the

Change-Id: If0e2cbebdbdebe7c71851d532b5f8629334b1aaf
Closes-Bug: #1724538
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Constraint Pandas and Numpy for gnocchi

The repo build is building pandas version 0.21.0rc1,
incompatible with gnocchi and numpy. This comes because gnocchi
isn't upper constrained, and the version to be installed is the
latest one available (due to a >= requirement).

We should instead constraint both pip packages to make possible
to install gnocchi.

Change-Id: If0e2cbebdbdebe7c71851d532b5f8629334b1aaf
Closes-Bug: #1724538

commit_message:
Clean up direct publisher

Direct publisher was applied to allow developers to
configure a publisher and provide the correlated dispatcher
interface. Dispatchers are being removed. Besides, the direct
publisher deprected last release and should be removed.

Change-Id: Ie257aa9485e14566b1918621f88b057b4339341f

[{'created': '2017-10-26 06:37:22.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': "Set notification_bind on zaqar websocket

Don't let zaqar websocket listen to notifications on all interfaces:
otherwise, it uses the hostname as a subscription target, and it doesn't
work when the host is set as an IPv6 host. Ultimately this should be
fixed in Zaqar, but this will work around it for now.

Change-Id: I78e0671024b93ec64740cd7a8cda227a5145b789

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set notification_bind on zaqar websocket

Don't let zaqar websocket listen to notifications on all interfaces:
otherwise, it uses the hostname as a subscription target, and it doesn't
work when the host is set as an IPv6 host. Ultimately this should be
fixed in Zaqar, but this will work around it for now.

Change-Id: I78e0671024b93ec64740cd7a8cda227a5145b789
Related-Bug: #1727406
(cherry picked from commit 5fdb4d7913bfc0096c725f6f99fd98e949c75d58)

commit_message:
Derive Params OvsPmdCoreList compute issue

This change is to compute DPDK derive parameter OvsPmdCoreList
correctly when DPDK NIC is associated to NUMA node 0 or
cores count is mentioned as same for all NUMA nodes.

Change-Id: I5fe6ccbd64a62cf0c6a3f4abf7785837a0d8f8c0
Closes-Bug: #1713733
(cherry picked from commit aada6658b86f463a1b3b45dd626f6ac61d9ca6c6)

commit_message:
Omit outward_rabbitmq from check for upgrade

 Upgrade fails as outward_rabbitmq does not exist
 and cannot therefore be upgraded. Omit it from the
 upgrade check and bootstrap it after rabbitmq upgrade.

 Remove jinja2 from 'Find gospel node' task; removes warnings.

Change-Id: I3766271c62779c8dbd31e7cf2300473815bbbe68

subject: Properly get pip version
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-20 19:16:41.000000000', 'files': ['inc/python'], 'message': "Properly get pip version

The old code was strip()ing the version string instead of split()ing the
version string so we always got the first character of the version
string. This worked fine as long as the pip version was single digit but
as soon as it rolls over to '10.stuff' we will compare:

  pip version 1 (instead of 10) > 6

Which fails bceause 1 is less than six. Instaed we really do want to
compare 10 > 6 so use split on '.' instead.

Change-Id: Ic7d0c04d7fa77774ab2d70fb9d11f182becec553
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Properly get pip version

The old code was strip()ing the version string instead of split()ing the
version string so we always got the first character of the version
string. This worked fine as long as the pip version was single digit but
as soon as it rolls over to '10.stuff' we will compare:

  pip version 1 (instead of 10) > 6

Which fails bceause 1 is less than six. Instaed we really do want to
compare 10 > 6 so use split on '.' instead.

Change-Id: Ic7d0c04d7fa77774ab2d70fb9d11f182becec553

commit_message:
Remove usage of 'tripleo' gate queue

The gate is currently killing us with resets (caused by timeouts, being
investigated by the team).

Right now, the common queue doesn't help us, we want to get rid of it
until we stabilize things again.

Change-Id: I5a887010b137baffbe9b78811a30d5379733df34

subject: Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-31 01:08:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

Storlets already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
    setup_requires=['pbr>=1.9', 'setuptools>=17.1'],
    pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: Id5687622ecdbc4db33f48f1906ae1027deacd2ed
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-08-31 01:31:21.000000000', 'files': ['MANIFEST.in'], 'message': "Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

Storlets already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
    setup_requires=['pbr>=1.9', 'setuptools>=17.1'],
    pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: Id5687622ecdbc4db33f48f1906ae1027deacd2ed
Closes-Bug: #1608980
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

Storlets already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
    setup_requires=['pbr>=1.9', 'setuptools>=17.1'],
    pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: Id5687622ecdbc4db33f48f1906ae1027deacd2ed
Closes-Bug: #1608980

commit_message:
WIP: Add functional resize tests using shared storage

Still needs work on confirming the resize and checking
allocations after that. This does show the issue though
since the healing task in the compute service actually
fails to overwrite the allocations for the instance for
all providers because it 409s trying to allocate DISK_GB
to the compute node provider which has no DISK_GB inventory.

Many of the tests from the superclass are currently marked
as TODOs in the subclass.

Change-Id: Ia59c82166562a99a584d0267da6b5934c1bef4cd
Related-Bug: #1707256

commit_message:
DNM: Test multi-cell (2)

The dvr-ha multinode job that runs in the devstack
experimental queue is a 3-node job, so it would be
cool to test out real multiple cells. We know things
like migration operations between cells aren't supported
and that might cause some tests to fail, but let's see
what blows up.

Change-Id: Ia39a4d4e4f0e01852ffc4218d74c4dc96607391f

commit_message:
DNM: test new style volume attach with live migration

This pulls together the two changes to enable new-style
volume attachments using cinder 3.27 and the change
which triggers new live migration logic when the
volumes are attached in that new style.

Eventually once this is passing the live migration job we'll
line these up in the same series such that the live migration
change comes before the API changes for using new style
volume attachments.

Depends-On: Ifc01dbf98545104c998ab96f65ff8623a6db0f28
Depends-On: I0bfb11296430dfffe9b091ae7c3a793617bd9d0d

Also depends on a Tempest change to unskip the
test_volume_backed_live_migration test.

Depends-On: If90f6d693a09c442c9d354d62219edc962da547f

This change depends on an update to test_iscsi_volume in Tempest
for additional volume attachment validation.

Depends-On: I72ccf82debe36607b58fa75e52af535494999959

Change-Id: I1e5272cff8234cf6085e0c937f24633fe9c60b36

subject: Avoid unnecessary lazy-loads in mutated_migration_context
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-06 21:30:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance.py'], 'message': "Avoid unnecessary lazy-loads in mutated_migration_context

If the instance isn't being migrated and has the
migration_context attribute set to None, like during a rebuild
operation, we should detect that and exit early rather
than lazy-load several fields (numa_topology, pci_requests,
and pci_devices - all separately) and then just not use/need
them.

Change-Id: I071ab575bfd80db029d542cebfdb3d4e34227881
Closes-Bug: #1696221
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Avoid unnecessary lazy-loads in mutated_migration_context

If the instance isn't being migrated and has the
migration_context attribute set to None, like during a rebuild
operation, we should detect that and exit early rather
than lazy-load several fields (numa_topology, pci_requests,
and pci_devices - all separately) and then just not use/need
them.

Change-Id: I071ab575bfd80db029d542cebfdb3d4e34227881
Closes-Bug: #1696221

commit_message:
Optimize zuul v3 jobs

- move check container failure from post.yml to run.yml
- add binary related jobs
- use static kolla-ansible src dir, which is helpful for kolla project
  to use.
- generate correct /etc/hosts by using private ip address and hostname
- fix the wrong api interface in global.yml file

Change-Id: Idfdee6dfe18f0fa2d4f984df59b57553122ce298
(cherry picked from commit bc3b7a7477975467e80d0d0b17a3f5693300d904)

commit_message:
Updated templates for heat-dashboard

heat-dashboard needs openstack/horizon as required-projects to run the
relevant jobs.  Therefore updated templates of heat-dashboard in
zuul.d/projects.yaml

commit_message:
Update neutron-failure-rate grafana dashboard

Re-arrange to have gate jobs at top, check jobs after, followed
by periodic jobs, etc.

Also added some missing jobs from last update:
 - legacy-tempest-dsvm-py35 (gate and check)
 - ironic-tempest-dsvm-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa
 - build-openstack-sphinx-docs

Added note at top to denote 'No datapoints' meant there had been
no job failures reported yet for a section.

Change-Id: Ida0ce854a32a01eeb8e75978e267b321c5a5d510

commit_message:
Use generic user for both zuul v2 and v3

Zuul v2 uses 'jenkins' as user, but Zuul v3 uses 'zuul'.
Using $USER solves it for both cases.

Change-Id: I7483b38c4af5b02813bbc5ff950b703cfae5f9df

[{'created': '2017-10-16 16:18:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add RSD client into requirements

RSD client has released the first version of its OpenStackClient

could add it into the requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I156cdfbd0afaf9f7e5f41749545e2b8bff663b96
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-10-16 18:47:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add RSD client into requirements

RSD client has released the first version of its OpenStackClient
plugin. Since we would like to add this plugin into OpenStackClient
doc, we need rsdclient to be part of this list so that other projects
could add it into the requirements.txt.

Questions for new requirement:

1. Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, python-rsdclient released the initial version in this month and
will continue to support further RSD version in the future.
https://github.com/openstack/python-rsdclient

2. Is the library good code?

This library followed the OpenStack convention to add all necessary
unit test cases, and the OpenStackClient plugin provided by this
project has passed related OpenStackClient tests.

3. Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes, it is compatible with python 3, and passed all python 3 test
cases.

4. Is the library license compatible?

Yes, it released under Apache 2.0 license.

5. Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
latest / Fedora latest)?

Current it has not been packaged in any distros, because it just
released the initial version 0.1.0.

6.Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
in global-requirements.txt?

No, this library provides the specific RSD OSC plugin, which it
reason why this library is created.

7. Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?

Yes, when add the RSD plugin into OpenStackClient plugin list, it
requires it has been add global requirements at first, then OSC will
install it to automatically generate usage document.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/511683/

8. If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process
does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

This project is not released by the OpenStack release project, because
it is not official OpenStack project, but only provides specific RSD
plugin to allow user to invoke RSD API through OpenStackClient.

9. Do I need to update anything else?

No, the initial version also has been added into upper-constraints.txt.

Change-Id: I156cdfbd0afaf9f7e5f41749545e2b8bff663b96

commit_message:
Add RSD client into requirements

RSD client has released the first version of its OpenStackClient
plugin. Since we would like to add this plugin into OpenStackClient
doc, we need rsdclient to be part of this list so that other projects
could add it into the requirements.txt.

Questions for new requirement:

1. Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, python-rsdclient released the initial version in this month and
will continue to support further RSD version in the future.
https://github.com/openstack/python-rsdclient

2. Is the library good code?

This library followed the OpenStack convention to add all necessary
unit test cases, and the OpenStackClient plugin provided by this
project has passed related OpenStackClient tests.

3. Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes, it is compatible with python 3, and passed all python 3 test
cases.

4. Is the library license compatible?

Yes, it released under Apache 2.0 license.

5. Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
latest / Fedora latest)?

Current it has not been packaged in any distros, because it just
released the initial version 0.1.0.

6.Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
in global-requirements.txt?

No, this library provides the specific RSD OSC plugin, which it
reason why this library is created.

7. Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?

Yes, when add the RSD plugin into OpenStackClient plugin list, it
requires it has been add global requirements at first, then OSC will
install it to automatically generate usage document.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/511683/

8. If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process
does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

This project is not released by the OpenStack release project, because
it is not official OpenStack project, but only provides specific RSD
plugin to allow user to invoke RSD API through OpenStackClient.

9. Do I need to update anything else?

No, the initial version also has been added into upper-constraints.txt.

Change-Id: I156cdfbd0afaf9f7e5f41749545e2b8bff663b96

commit_message:
Haproxy VIP address override

The haproxy playbook now has a variable for vip endpoint addresses which
can be used to override them based on the needs of the deployment. This
is extremely useful in cases where the `*_lb_vip_address`(s) are nat'd.
The new variables are  `haproxy_external_lb_vip_address` which has a
default of `external_lb_vip_address` and `haproxy_internal_lb_vip_address`
with a default of `internal_lb_vip_address`.

Change-Id: I13154c5de492cf51829bfa3573ec3e17bd920623
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
use external net api def from lib

The external network extension's API definition was rehomed into
neutron-lib with I9933b91d1e82db3891b3b72f06e94316e56a4f15. This patch
consumes it, switching over to neutron-lib's modules in prep for
I696b52265b9528082cd2524f05febe2338376488

Change-Id: Id1dfe8cf0ec50f1206dd997c9303756683ab5e00

commit_message:
Add default configuration files to data_files

In order to make it simpler to use the default
configuration files when deploying services
from source, the files are added to pbr's
data_files section so that the files are
included in the built wheels and therefore
deployed with the code. Packaging and deployment
tools can then more easily use the default files
if they wish to.

This pattern is already established with similar
files for neutron, designate and glance as has
been mentioned in the related bug report.

Change-Id: Iaa47bcb1a9eb34caddc80a813a703eea591142e7
Closes-Bug: #1718356

commit_message:
conf: Move additional nova-net opts to 'network'

Change I40b2372 moved some nova-network opts from 'floating_ips' to
'network'. It turns out there are more nova-network opts in other files.
Move some of these for the same reasons given in that change.

Note that there are still other nova-network opts in other files.
However, these are all in non-DEFAULT groups and should stay where
they are for now.

Change-Id: Id734bc751566a80a296af204dbbfc09fca5e34b8

commit_message:
WIP reorder destination host setup

- experimental change to test if reordering
  self.network_api.setup_networks_on_host
  before calling self.driver.pre_live_migration
  will break existing workflow.

- This change should allow regeneration of the
  instance defintion to account for changes in
  port bindings between source and target hosts.

- This change should not be merged as written as
  it will break connectivity for the instance
  when the portbinding is updated. The correct
  change is to create a new port binding for the
  destination but not activate it until we plug
  the interface on the destination host.

- multiple bindings is requied to enable the late
  activation and will be introduced by
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/414251/

Change-Id: I57be2c9534fd865fe1c9fa2c254e0a62a8158405

commit_message:
Bypass web server during service setup

When connecting directly to a keystone host during service setup, use
the UWSGI ports instead of going through the web server to avoid any
potential errors with differing URI protocols or SSL certs not including
the hostnames of individual hosts.

Change-Id: Ie5b33f9d0210a23badb63cab72c481b027790be3
Closes-Bug: 1699191
(cherry picked from commit cabd7e9cef8c35df08958677892a82551b210c97)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-03 10:35:40.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': "Fix scheduler_host_manager limitation

We support customization of scheduler's host manager, driver, and
filters, but when we made the scheduler Pool aware we greatly limited
this possibility because now instead of passing BackendState (previously
called HostState) to the filters we are passing PoolState, which cannot
be easily customized.

Prior to this if you wanted to have a custom BackendState class you
would just have to extend HostManager class and define the class
attribute backend_state_cls before using it in config's
scheduler_host_manager.

Now it will not be enough with that because PoolState class is hardcoded
in the BackendState's methods, so you'll have to actually copy all the
code from that class just so you can replace the PoolState class
instantiations.

This patch fixes this by creating an instance attribute on
initialization method, this way extending classes will just have to call
parent's initialization and then replace the value of the pool_state_cls
attribute.

Due to a circular dependency between BackendState and PoolState (which
inherits from BackendState) we cannot just add it as a class attribute,
so we do it as an instance attribute instead.

If we want to add it as a class attribute we would have to add after the
PoolState class definition the following:

 BackendState.pool_state_cls = PoolState

Conceptually that's closer to what we want (a class attribute) but the
implementation is worse because you end up assigning the class attribute
270 lines away from where it should have been defined.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I2c63806c4e9b1305742c7f07f47b95ba243c1666
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix scheduler_host_manager limitation

We support customization of scheduler's host manager, driver, and
filters, but when we made the scheduler Pool aware we greatly limited
this possibility because now instead of passing BackendState (previously
called HostState) to the filters we are passing PoolState, which cannot
be easily customized.

Prior to this if you wanted to have a custom BackendState class you
would just have to extend HostManager class and define the class
attribute backend_state_cls before using it in config's
scheduler_host_manager.

Now it will not be enough with that because PoolState class is hardcoded
in the BackendState's methods, so you'll have to actually copy all the
code from that class just so you can replace the PoolState class
instantiations.

This patch fixes this by creating an instance attribute on
initialization method, this way extending classes will just have to call
parent's initialization and then replace the value of the pool_state_cls
attribute.

Due to a circular dependency between BackendState and PoolState (which
inherits from BackendState) we cannot just add it as a class attribute,
so we do it as an instance attribute instead.

If we want to add it as a class attribute we would have to add after the
PoolState class definition the following:

 BackendState.pool_state_cls = PoolState

Conceptually that's closer to what we want (a class attribute) but the
implementation is worse because you end up assigning the class attribute
270 lines away from where it should have been defined.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I2c63806c4e9b1305742c7f07f47b95ba243c1666

commit_message:
Add functions for managing DNS Entries

Add code for managing DNS Entries via hacluster. This is part of the
effort to enable DNS HA in the reactive charms.

Change-Id: I1a6cdeffa3aa8657b957ba68cd09face27f93b27
Partial-Bug: #1727376
